objective.answer: The primary objective of the paper is to design and assess a novel device, the Mimetic Poet, which uses generative AI to facilitate creative ideation, inspiration, and reflective thought through a poetic interface.
objective.evidence: This paper presents the design and initial assessment of a novel device that uses generative AI to facilitate creative ideation, inspiration, and reflective thought.

knowledge_gap.answer: The paper addresses the gap in understanding how generative AI systems might support creativity via creative strategies, which is relatively underdeveloped.
knowledge_gap.evidence: However, ways of understanding how generative AI systems might support creativity via creative strategies is relatively underdeveloped (Koch et al. 2019; Koch et al. 2020; Verheijden and Funk 2023).

answer: The use of magnetic poetry as an interface for interacting with a large language model (LLM) to support creative ideation.
The development of a novel sorting algorithm using ray-tracing to determine the best sequencing of placed markers.
The implementation of a prompt chaining scheme to better control the LLM’s responses to input poems.
evidence: Called the Mimetic Poet, the device augments traditional magnetic poetry, using it as the mechanism for communicating with an LLM in an interactive dialogue over extended periods of time.
To compute the correct ordering of placed words we developed a novel sorting algorithm that uses ray-tracing (Whitted 1980) to determine the best sequencing of placed markers.
To address these issues, we developed a prompt chaining scheme (Wu et al. 2022) to better control the LLM’s responses to the input poems.

inspirational_papers.answer:
- Rajcic and McCormack (2023) Message ritual: A posthuman account of living with lamp. (Methodological precursors)
- Koch et al. (2019) May AI?: Design ideation with cooperative contextual bandits. (Experimental baselines)
inspirational_papers.evidence: We explore design possibilities beyond conventional forms of interaction with LLMs, such as “chatbot” interfaces popularised by systems such as OpenAI’s ChatGPT, instead designing speculative possibilities for what human-AI relationships could be (Rajcic and McCormack 2023).

steps.step: Design and build the Mimetic Poet device.
steps.input: Concept of magnetic poetry and generative AI.
steps.output: A physical device that uses magnetic poetry to interact with an LLM.
steps.evidence: The Mimetic Poet is designed as a stand-alone device that can sit easily in a studio, workplace or home.

steps.step: Develop a sorting algorithm for word sequencing.
steps.input: Positions of the center and corners of each detected marker.
steps.evidence: To compute the correct ordering of placed words we developed a novel sorting algorithm that uses ray-tracing.

steps.step: Implement prompt chaining for LLM responses.
steps.input: Input poems and desired response modes.
steps.evidence: To address these issues, we developed a prompt chaining scheme to better control the LLM’s responses to the input poems.

tools.name: OpenAI’s GPT-4 API
tools.description: Used for generating responses to input poems.
tools.evidence: We use OpenAI’s GPT4, accessed via the Python API.

tools.name: LangChain
tools.description: Facilitates prompt design and chaining with interchangeable LLM services.
tools.evidence: We utilised LangChain, a python package which facilitates prompt design and chaining with interchangeable LLM services.

methods.name: Hypothesis or Idea Generation
methods.description: The system produces candidate hypotheses or new research ideas from prior knowledge or external input.
methods.evidence: The user just input the following text: {poem} Try and develop a creative idea or strategy that builds upon similarities between these words/concepts presented.

methods.name: Transformation/structurization of user input
methods.description: The approach includes transforming user input into structured data for further processing.
methods.evidence: If no word is moved for a few seconds, the text of the poem, including new lines, punctuation, etc. is converted to a string and the string sent to the AI subsystem.

areas.name: Interdisciplinary Sciences
areas.description: The paper explores new forms of human-AI interaction through creative and artistic means.
areas.evidence: We propose an alternative way to engage with LLMs, building a novel form of interface designed to support ideation and creative thinking.

performance_summary.summary: Participants found the device engaging and a desirable alternative to traditional chat-based interfaces.
performance_summary.evidence: Our findings showed that some encounters with the device helped participants in creative thinking and ideation, and that the interface was a desirable alternative to traditional chat-based interfaces.

limitations.name: Limited Participant Feedback
limitations.description: Only a subset of participants took part in the focus group, limiting the breadth of feedback.
limitations.evidence: Only a subset (6) of participants took part in the focus group, so we weren’t able to canvas all participant’s opinions of the device.

limitations.name: Prototype Limitations
limitations.description: The current form of the device was not directly responsible for solving practical creative problems.
limitations.evidence: We did not find that the device, in its current form, was directly responsible for solving practical creative problems.

future_directions.name: Interface Improvements
future_directions.description: Add feedback while composing a poem and markers for different AI personalities.
future_directions.evidence: Interface: additional feedback while composing a poem was seen as favourable amongst several participants; adding markers that represent different AI “personalities” that allow participants to customise the responses.

future_directions.name: Advanced Prompt Chains
future_directions.description: Develop more advanced prompt chains to improve AI response quality.
future_directions.evidence: Further development of more advanced prompt chains is needed to increase the quality and suitability of the AI responses.

future_directions.name: Personalization
future_directions.description: Incorporate past interactions into the prompt chain to enrich the experience.
future_directions.evidence: Adding the ability to personalise the model and incorporate past interactions into the prompt chain would allow the LLM to also reference a participant’s history of interactions.
